adjective.description: Relating to or denoting the earlier stage of the Proterozoic aeon in north-western Scotland, from about 2,500 to 1,100 million years ago, when the oldest rocks in Britain were deposited.

origin: Mid 19th century: from the name of the island of Lewis and Harris in the Outer Hebrides (where the chief outcrops of these rocks are found) + -ian.
